\subsection{Product}
The product of a pair of objects, if it exists, is another object such that it
represents the cartesian product of both of them.
\begin{definition}[Product\index{Product}]\label{def:product_limit}
	For a category $C$ and a discrete category $I$, the functor $F:I\to C$ is an
	$I$-indexed family of objects $(c_i)_{i\in I}$ in $C$. A product $\prod_{i\in
	I} c_i$ is the limit of such a functor $F$.
	\parencite{leinster:basic_category_theory}
\end{definition}

\begin{remark}
	In the case where $I=\underline{2}$ the product of objects $a$ and $b$ is
	denoted $a\times b$ and the resulting diagram (which must commute for all $c$)
	is as follows:
	% https://q.uiver.app/?
	\[\begin{tikzcd}[ampersand replacement=\&]
		\&\&\& c \\
		0 \& 1 \& a \& {a\times b} \& b
		\arrow["{\mathrm{fst}}", from=2-4, to=2-3]
		\arrow["{\mathrm{snd}}"', from=2-4, to=2-5]
		\arrow["h"', dashed, from=1-4, to=2-4]
		\arrow["g"', from=1-4, to=2-3]
		\arrow["h", from=1-4, to=2-5]
		\arrow[color={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=24pt}, dotted, from=2-1, to=2-3]
		\arrow[color={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=24pt}, dotted, from=2-2, to=2-5]
	\end{tikzcd}\]
\end{remark}

\subsubsection*{As a terminal morphism from the diagonal functor}
% https://q.uiver.app/?
\[\begin{tikzcd}
	{a\times b} & {\Delta(a\times b)} & {(a,b)} \\
	{c'} & {\Delta(c')}
	\arrow["{(\mathrm{fst},\mathrm{snd})}", from=1-2, to=1-3]
	\arrow["{f'}"', from=2-2, to=1-3]
	\arrow[""{name=0, anchor=center, inner sep=0}, "{\Delta(h)}", dashed, from=2-2, to=1-2]
	\arrow[""{name=1, anchor=center, inner sep=0}, "h", dashed, from=2-1, to=1-1]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, dotted, from=1-1, to=1-2]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, dotted, from=2-1, to=2-2]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, shorten <=8pt, shorten >=20pt, dotted, from=1, to=0]
\end{tikzcd}\]
